name: GitHub
description: GitHub is a platform for developers to host and review code, manage projects, and build software. It is a social platform that allows developers to collaborate and contribute to open-source projects.

feedFormulas.name: User activity
feedFormulas.description: This feed contains the most recent activity of a specific user.

feedFormulas.name: Releases
feedFormulas.description: This feed contains the most recent releases of a specific repository.

feedFormulas.name: Commits
feedFormulas.description: This feed contains the most recent commits of a specific repository.

feedFormulas.name: Tags
feedFormulas.description: This feed contains the most recent tags of a specific repository.

feedFormulas.name: News feed
feedFormulas.description: This feed contains the activity of the projects and users you are following. It requires passing an authentication token, which you can generate in your GitHub settings.

username.name: Username
username.description: The username of the user. You will also find it in the URL of the user's profile.

owner.name: Owner
owner.description: The owner of the repository. You will also find it in the URL of the repository.

repo.name: Repository
repo.description: The name of the repository. You will also find it in the URL of the repository.

token.name: Token
token.description: The token required to access the private feed. You can create a token in your GitHub settings.
